intro: Godetia hispidula, commonly known as the hairy godetia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers with four petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in fine pubescence. Godetia hispidula is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
